question: [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Integer overflow] Can an attacker craft an APIEvent with a creation_number exceeding i64::MAX (as u64), causing integer overflow when casting to i64 at line 51, potentially resulting in negative database keys and primary key collision attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Integer overflow] Does the sequence_number conversion from u64 to i64 at line 52 properly handle values >= 2^63, or can an attacker cause wraparound to negative values, corrupting event ordering in the database? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Integer overflow] Can transaction_version parameter exceed i64::MAX when passed from upstream components, causing silent overflow and incorrect indexing of events to wrong transaction versions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Integer overflow] Can transaction_block_height parameter overflow i64 bounds, allowing events to be indexed to incorrect block heights and breaking block-based event queries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_events()] [Integer overflow] In the enumerate() loop at line 68-69, can an attacker cause a transaction with more than i64::MAX events to overflow the event_index cast at line 74, resulting in negative or colliding indices? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Struct: Event] [Primary key collision] Given the composite primary key (account_address, creation_number, sequence_number) at line 12, can an attacker craft events with identical GUIDs but different data to cause database insertion conflicts and event data loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Struct: Event] [Primary key collision] If creation_number wraps due to overflow to negative values, can this collide with legitimate events from the same account, causing database constraint violations or silent overwrites? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Struct: Event] [Primary key collision] Can address standardization inconsistencies in standardize_address() cause the same logical account to have multiple representations, breaking the primary key uniqueness guarantee? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Primary key collision] Does the system properly handle event GUID reuse across different transaction versions, or can resubmitted transactions cause events to overwrite each other in the database? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Address manipulation] Does standardize_address() at line 50 properly handle malformed addresses, leading addresses (0x vs 0X), or addresses with mixed case, potentially causing the same account's events to be split across multiple database entries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Address manipulation] Can an attacker exploit case sensitivity in address strings before standardization to create lookup inconsistencies, causing events to be unfindable in database queries? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Address manipulation] Does standardize_address() properly validate address length and format, or can truncated/padded addresses cause events from different accounts to collide? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Address manipulation] Can null bytes or special characters in account_address string bypass standardization and cause SQL injection or database corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Struct: Event] [JSON injection] Does the data field at line 21 properly sanitize event.data.clone() before database insertion, or can malicious Move events inject SQL commands through crafted JSON payloads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [JSON manipulation] Can an attacker craft Move events with deeply nested JSON objects that cause database storage issues, query timeouts, or indexer crashes when processing the data field? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [JSON manipulation] Does the serde_json::Value at line 56 handle arbitrarily large JSON payloads, or can memory exhaustion attacks occur through events with massive data fields? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Struct: Event] [Data integrity] Can malicious validators emit events with corrupted or malformed JSON in the data field that gets silently stored, breaking downstream API consumers expecting valid JSON? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [JSON injection] Does event.data.clone() preserve numeric precision for large integers, or can precision loss occur causing financial data corruption in token transfer events? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Type manipulation] Does the type_ field at line 55 validate event.typ.to_string() length, or can unbounded Move type strings cause database storage issues or index bloat? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Type manipulation] Can an attacker craft malicious Move modules with extremely long type names including nested generics to cause DoS when converting to string for database storage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Struct: Event] [Type injection] Does the type_ string field properly escape special characters, or can malicious type names with SQL metacharacters cause injection vulnerabilities in type-based queries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Type confusion] Can type string manipulation or normalization inconsistencies cause events of the same logical type to be indexed under different type strings, breaking event filtering? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_event()] [Sequence manipulation] Does the system validate that sequence_number monotonically increases for each GUID, or can out-of-order events cause database state inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_events()] [Ordering attack] In the enumerate() loop at line 68-69, if events array is manipulated before indexing, can event_index values become non-sequential, breaking transaction event ordering? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/events.rs] [Function: from_events()] [Race condition] Can concurrent calls to from_events() with the same transaction_version cause race conditions where events are indexed out of order or with duplicate indices? (High)
